00050 class EngineUtil {
00051 
00052 public:
00053 
00054   /**
00055    * Read in a file of probe IDs
00056    * @param probeIds - vector of probeid_t to fill in, these are zero base
00057    * @param probeFileName - the file to load, file has 1 base probe IDs
00058    */
00059   static void readProbeFile(std::vector<probeid_t> &probeIds, const std::string& probeFileName);
00060   static void readProbeFile(std::vector< std::vector< probeid_t > > &probeIds, 
00061                             const std::string& probeFileName);
00062   static void readProbeFiles(std::vector<probeid_t> &probeIds, 
00063                              const std::vector<std::string>& probeFileNames);
00064 
00065   /**
00066    * Read in a file of probeset names or IDs
00067    * @param probeSets - vector of probeset names or IDs to fill in
00068    * @param probeSetFileName - the file to load, file has 1 base probe IDs
00069    */
00070   static void readProbeSetFile(std::vector<std::string> &probeSets, const std::string& probeSetFileName);
00071   static void readProbeSetFiles(std::vector<std::string> &probeSets,
00072                                 const std::vector<std::string>& probeSetFileNames);
00073 
00074   /**
00075    * Read in the probe class file
00076    *
00077    * @param file   - The file to read
00078    * @param masks  - Vector of probe masks to fill in
00079    */
00080   static void readProbeClassFile(const std::string &file, 
00081           const int arraySize, 
00082           std::map<std::string, std::vector<bool> > &classMap);
00083 
00084   /**
00085    * Return true if the qType of chip is found in the list of possible
00086    * types that are ok. Note that this is a case sensitive operation and
00087    * is meant to be so.
00088    * 
00089    */
00090   static bool checkChipTypeOk(const std::string &qType, 
00091                               const std::vector<std::string> &possibleTypes);
00092 
00093   /**
00094    * Check chip types in TSV file against those in vector. Call Err::errAbort
00095    * if no match is found.
00096    */
00097   static void checkTsvFileChipType(const std::string &path, 
00098                                    const std::vector<std::string> &chipTypes,
00099                                    bool mustSee = false);
00100 
00101   /**
00102    * Check to make sure that there is at least one match between the two
00103    * vectors of chip types. Call Err::errAbort() if not.
00104    */
00105   static void checkChipTypeVectors(std::vector<std::string> &chipTypesOk,
00106                                    std::vector<std::string> &chipTypesCheck);
00107 
00108   /** 
00109    * Check to make sure all the cel files are compatible with the
00110    * chiptypes supported and number or probes on them. Treats the empty
00111    * string "" as a wildcard, so if chipTypes contains "" then any chip
00112    * type is accepted, but only if number of probes is correct. Calls
00113    * Err::errAbort() if something is wrong.
00114    * 
00115    * @param chipTypes - Names of chiptypes that are compatible.
00116    * @param probeCount - How many probes (aka features, ada cels) should be on array.
00117    * @param celFiles - Vector of cel file names to check.
00118    */
00119   static void checkCelChipTypes(std::vector<std::string> &chipTypes, 
00120                                 uint32_t probeCount,
00121                                 std::vector<std::string> &celFiles, 
00122                                 uint32_t rows, 
00123                                 uint32_t cols);
00124 
00125  /** 
00126   * Check to make sure all the cel files are compatible with the
00127   * given analysis type.
00128   * 
00129   * @param analysisName - Name of the analysis to be checked e.g. gc-correction. 
00130   * @param celFiles - Vector of cel file names to check.
00131   */
00132   static void checkCelAnalysisType(std::string analysisName, 
00133                                        std::vector<std::string> &celFiles);
00134 
00135   /** 
00136    * @brief Get a list from a text file to select a subset of probe sets for
00137    * analysis.
00138    * 
00139    * @param fileName - Path to file for reading probe subset from.
00140    * @param psGroups - Groups to be filled in, must be deleted later
00141    * @param psNameLoadMap - Map of probesets names to be loaded which is
00142    * filled in.
00143    */
00144   static void makePSetNameSubset(const std::string &fileName, 
00145                                  std::vector<ProbeSetGroup *> &psGroups, 
00146                                  std::map<std::string, bool> &psNameLoadMap);
00147 
00148   /** 
00149    * Open up a pgf and clf file pair and read the valid chiptypes
00150    * (i.e. HuEx-1_0-st-v2, HuEx-1_0-st-v1, HuEx-1_0-st-ta1) and number
00151    * of probes expected from them.
00152    * 
00153    * @param chipTypes - Names of chiptypes that this pgf file is compatible with.
00154    * @param probeCount - Number of probes that are on chip according to clf file.
00155    * @param pgfFile - Name of pgf file to be opened and read from.
00156    * @param clfFile - Name of clf file to be opened and read from.
00157    */
00158   static void getPgfChipType(std::vector<std::string>& chipTypes, 
00159                              colrow_t& rowCount, 
00160                              colrow_t& colCount,
00161                              int& probeCount,
00162                              // @todo: which isnt this signature like the others?
00163                              // int& probeSetCount,
00164                              const std::string& pgfFile, 
00165                              const std::string& clfFile);
00166 
00167   /** 
00168    * Open up a spf (simple probe format) file and read the valid chiptypes 
00169    * (i.e. HuEx-1_0-st-v2, HuEx-1_0-st-v1, HuEx-1_0-st-ta1) and number
00170    * of probes expected.
00171    * 
00172    * @param chipTypes - Names of chiptypes that this pgf file is compatible with.
00173    * @param probeCount - Number of probes that are on chip according to spf file.
00174    * @param spfFile - Name of spf file to be opened and read from.
00175    */
00176   static void getSpfChipType(std::vector<std::string>& chipTypes, 
00177                              colrow_t& rowCount, 
00178                              colrow_t& colCount,
00179                              int& probeCount,
00180                              int& probeSetCount,
00181                              const std::string& spfFile);
00182 
00183   /** 
00184    * Open up a cdf file and get the chip type (i.e. 'Mapping250K_Sty') and number
00185    * of probes on the chip.
00186    * 
00187    * @param chipTypes - Names of chiptypes that this pgf file is compatible with.
00188    * @param rowCount - Number of rows on the chip.
00189    * @param colCount - Number of columns on chip.
00190    * @param probeCount - Number of probes that are on chip according to clf file.
00191    * @param cdfFile - Name of cdf file to be opened and read from.
00192    */
00193   static void getCdfChipType(std::vector<std::string>& chipTypes, 
00194                              colrow_t& rowCount, 
00195                              colrow_t& colCount,
00196                              int& probeCount,
00197                              int& probeSetCount,
00198                              const std::string& cdfFile);
00199 
00200 
00201   /**
00202    * @brief Print out a header and then a series of self documenting
00203    * objects.
00204    * @param header - Descriptive header for this collection of self documenting objects.
00205    * @param doc - Collection of self documenting objects.
00206    */
00207   void static printSelfDocs(const char *header, std::vector<SelfDoc> doc);
00208 
00209   void static explainParameter(const std::string& query);
00210 
00211   void static getCelFiles(std::vector<std::string> &celFiles, BaseEngine *engine);
00212 
00213   void static getChpFiles(std::vector<std::string> &celFiles, BaseEngine *engine);

00215 };
